subject: Creativity
title: Silence in Dialogue: What Pauses Reveal
description: A quick, practical guide to Silence in Dialogue: What Pauses Reveal.

hook.text: 'Do you love me?' Silence. That silence says more than any words could. In writing, what's NOT said often matters most.

buildup.text: Hemingway's 'iceberg theory' argues that the real story lives below the surface â€” in what characters avoid, deflect.

discovery.text: A pause after a question signals conflict. A changed subject signals avoidance. A non-answer IS an answer.

twist.text: Cormac McCarthy uses almost no quotation marks and minimal dialogue tags.

climax.text: The most powerful moment in many novels is a character choosing NOT to speak when a response is expected.

punchline.text: In great dialogue, silence speaks loudest.

quiz.question: What is Hemingway's 'iceberg theory' about in writing?
options: Stories should be set in cold places
The real story lives below the surface in what's unsaid
